author: Staff Reporter
text:
Superintendent of Police Ashwin M. Kotnis addressing the meeting of mobile team members deputed for election work in Thoothukudi district on Saturday.— Photo: N. Rajesh

To ensure smooth conduct of the election in the six Assembly constituencies in Thoothukudi district on May 16, the role and responsibilities of mobile parties deputed at zonal levels were briefed by Superintendent of Police Ashwin M. Kotnis at a training programme here on Saturday.

The district had 129 zones and the personnel were asked to maintain strict vigil during the polls. The participants were told how to despatch electronic voting machines carefully to polling booths and safe methods to be followed to take such EVMs to the counting centre after the polling was over.

Mr. Kotnis appealed to them to stick to the tasks assigned to them and discharge their duties promptly.

Later talking to the media, the SP said that 153 preventive cases had been booked under Section 107 of the Code of Criminal Procedure and 750 persons facing cases were kept under watch by the police.

He said that the Revenue Department officials had been working in coordination with the police. Seven companies of paramilitary forces were expected to be deployed in the district to provide security during the polls, and Tamil Nadu Special Police personnel were also sought.

Around 1,900 police personnel in the district would be involved for poll security.
title: Mobile parties instructed to maintain strict vigil
